metadata.title: CVE-2023-52507 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nfc:nci: assert requested protocol is valid The protocol is used in a bit maskto determine if the protocol is supported. Assert the provided protocol isless than the maximum defined so it doesn't potentially perform ashift-out-of-bounds and provide a clearer error for undefined protocols vsunsupported ones.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52507` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-lowlatency - 4.15.0-232.244
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-171-generic - 5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-171-lowlatency - 5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-232.244').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1159.164').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1176.189').
